specifications.Finish: Chemical > Burnout Burnout finish is a technique where chemicals are applied to a fabric made of two or more fibers with different chemical properties. The chemicals dissolve or “burn out” one type of fiber, removing it from the fabric. This creates a semi-transparent pattern or texture as the remaining fibers stand out. Burnout finish adds a unique, decorative effect with a mix of sheer and solid areas. However, due to the nature of the chemical process, slight variations in the pattern may occur between batches.
specifications.Care Advice: Knit When you receive a knit product, it may be stiff and wrinkled. This is because the fabric has been folded and compressed for shipping. To soften and straighten the fabric, you should condition it for 2-3 days at room temperature before using it.
specifications.Care Instructions: Hand wash only Wash separately Turn inside out before washing, Do not wring, Do not rub Do not bleach Line dry Do not iron
